                    
                    12. Whoever abets, within the meaning of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œPenal Codeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œPakistan Penal Codeâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >20</a></sup></span></span>[Penal Code], the commission of an offence punishable under this Act, or the rules made under this Act, or attempts to commit any such offence and in such attempt does any act towards the commission of the same, shall be punished as if he had committed the offence. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Power to arrest without warrant persons committing dangerous offences

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    13. Whoever is found committing any act for which he is punishable under this Act or the rules under this Act, and which tends to cause explosion or fire in or about any place where an explosive is manufactured or stored, or any railway or port, or any carriage, ship or boat, may be apprehended without warrant by a Police-officer, or by the occupier of, or the agent or servant of, or other person authorised by the occupier of, that place, or by any agent or servant of, or other person authorised by, the railway administration or conservator of the port, and be removed from the place where he is arrested and conveyed as soon as conveniently may be before a Magistrate. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Saving and power to exempt

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    14. (1) Nothing in this Act, except sections 8, 9 and 9A, shall apply to the manufacture, possession, use, transport or importation of any explosive-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	by any of the armed forces of Bangladesh in accordance with rules or regulations made by the Government;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	by any person employed under the Government in execution of this Act.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> (2) The Government may by notification in the official Gazette exempt, absolutely or subject to any such conditions as it may think fit to impose, any explosive from all or any of the provisions of this Act.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>15. Nothing in this Act shall affect the provisions of the <a title='Arms Act, 1878' href='/act-38.html'>Arms Act, 1878</a>:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that an authority granting a license under this Act for the manufacture, possession, sale, transport or importation of an explosive may, if empowered in this behalf by the rules under which the license is granted, direct by an order written on the license that it shall have the effect of a like license granted under the said Arms Act.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>16. Nothing in this Act or the rules under this Act shall prevent any person from being prosecuted under any other law for any act or omission which constitutes an offence against this Act or those rules, or from being liable under that other law to any other or higher punishment or penalty than that provided by this Act or those rules: Provided that a person shall not be punished twice for the same offence.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>17. The Government may, from time to time, by notification in the official Gazette, declare that any substance which appears to the Government to be specially dangerous to life or property, by reason either of its explosive properties or of any process in the manufacture thereof being liable to explosion, shall be deemed to be an explosive within the meaning of this Act, and the provisions of this Act (subject to such exceptions, limitations, and restrictions as may be specified in the notification) shall accordingly extend to that substance in like manner as if it were included in the definition or the term â€œexplosiveâ€ in this Act.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>18. (1) An authority making rules under this Act shall, before making the rules, publish a draft of the proposed rules for the information of persons likely to be affected thereby.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The publication shall be made in such manner as the Government, from time to time, by notification in the official Gazette prescribes.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) There shall be published with the draft a notice specifying a date at or after which the draft will be taken into consideration.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) The authority making the rules shall receive and consider any objection or suggestion which may be made by any person with respect to the draft before the date so specified.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(5) A rule made under this Act shall not take effect until it has been published in the official Gazette.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(6) The publication in the official Gazette or a rule purporting to be made under this Act shall be conclusive evidence that it has been duly made, and, if it requires sanction, that it has been duly sanctioned.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(7) All powers to make rules conferred by this Act may be exercised from time to time as occasion requires.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Saving of Arms Act, 1878

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    15. Nothing in this Act shall affect the provisions of the <a title='Arms Act, 1878' href='/act-38.html'>Arms Act, 1878</a>:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that an authority granting a license under this Act for the manufacture, possession, sale, transport or importation of an explosive may, if empowered in this behalf by the rules under which the license is granted, direct by an order written on the license that it shall have the effect of a like license granted under the said Arms Act. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Saving as to liability under other law

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    16. Nothing in this Act or the rules under this Act shall prevent any person from being prosecuted under any other law for any act or omission which constitutes an offence against this Act or those rules, or from being liable under that other law to any other or higher punishment or penalty than that provided by this Act or those rules: Provided that a person shall not be punished twice for the same offence. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Extension of definition of â€œexplosiveâ€ to other explosive substances

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    17. The Government may, from time to time, by notification in the official Gazette, declare that any substance which appears to the Government to be specially dangerous to life or property, by reason either of its explosive properties or of any process in the manufacture thereof being liable to explosion, shall be deemed to be an explosive within the meaning of this Act, and the provisions of this Act (subject to such exceptions, limitations, and restrictions as may be specified in the notification) shall accordingly extend to that substance in like manner as if it were included in the definition or the term â€œexplosiveâ€ in this Act. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Procedure for making publication and confirmation of rules

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    18. (1) An authority making rules under this Act shall, before making the rules, publish a draft of the proposed rules for the information of persons likely to be affected thereby.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The publication shall be made in such manner as the Government, from time to time, by notification in the official Gazette prescribes.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) There shall be published with the draft a notice specifying a date at or after which the draft will be taken into consideration.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) The authority making the rules shall receive and consider any objection or suggestion which may be made by any person with respect to the draft before the date so specified.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(5) A rule made under this Act shall not take effect until it has been published in the official Gazette.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(6) The publication in the official Gazette or a rule purporting to be made under this Act shall be conclusive evidence that it has been duly made, and, if it requires sanction, that it has been duly sanctioned.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(7) All powers to make rules conferred by this Act may be exercised from time to time as occasion requires. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

<script>

        $(document).ready(function() {
            $('.test-tooltip').tooltip();
            // find tags and remove
            // remove empty p tag
            $('p').each(function () {
                var $this = $(this);
                if ($this.html().replace(/\s|&nbsp;/g, '').length == 0)
                    $this.remove();
            });


            $(document).on('click','.advancedSearch',function (event) {
                console.log(event);
                $('.advancedSearchForm').toggle("slow");
            })

            $('[data-toggle="tooltip"]').tooltip();
            String.prototype.bn_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/0/g,'à§¦')
                        .replace(/1/g,'à§§')
                        .replace(/2/g,'à§¨')
                        .replace(/3/g,'à§©')
                        .replace(/4/g,'à§ª')
                        .replace(/5/g,'à§«')
                        .replace(/6/g,'à§¬')
                        .replace(/7/g,'à§­')
                        .replace(/8/g,'à§®')
                        .replace(/9/g,'à§¯');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }



            String.prototype.en_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/à§¦/g,'0')
                        .replace(/à§§/g,'1')
                        .replace(/à§¨/g,'2')
                        .replace(/à§©/g,'3')
                        .replace(/à§ª/g,'4')
                        .replace(/à§«/g,'5')
                        .replace(/à§¬/g,'6')
                        .replace(/à§­/g,'7')
                        .replace(/à§®/g,'8')
                        .replace(/à§¯/g,'9');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-td-index]",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var filter = [];

                $(this).parents("form").find("[data-td-index]").each(function (index){
                    if ($(this).val().trim()!="" && $(this).val()!=null){
                        filter.push(
                                {
                                    "bn": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number(),
                                    "en": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number(),
                                    "td": $(this).data("td-index")
                                }
                        )
                     }
                })


                var trs = table.find("tbody tr");

                $.each(trs, function (index, tr) {
                    var rowShow = true;
                    $.each(filter, function (ind, val){
                        console.log(val);
                        var td = $(tr).find("td").get(val["td"]);
                        var text = $(td).text();

                        if (text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["en"]) > -1
                        || text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["bn"]) > -1){
                            rowShow = rowShow && true;
                        }else{
                            rowShow = false;
                        }
                    })
                    if (rowShow==true){
                        $(tr).show();
                    }else{
                        $(tr).hide();
                    }
                } )

            })

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-search]",function () {


                var searchContent = $(this).data("search");

                var filter1 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number();
                var filter2 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number();


                var rows = $(document).find(searchContent);


                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < rows.length; i++) {

                    var row = rows[i];
                    if (row) {
                        if ($(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter1) > -1
                                ||$(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter2) > -1
                        ) {
                            $(row).show();
                        } else {
                            $(row).hide();
                        }
                    }
                }
            })

            $(document).find(".removableRowTable").each(function (index) {
                console.log($(this).find("tbody tr").length);
                $(this).find("tbody").each(function () {
                    if ($(this).find("tr").length<=1){
                        $(this).remove();
                    }
                })
            })


            $(document).on("reset","form",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var tr = table.find("tbody tr");
                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < tr.length; i++) {

                    tr[i].style.display = "";

                }
            })

        });

                },

                trigger: null, // Set a custom triggering element. Can be an HTML string or jQuery object
                target: null, // Set a custom target element for scrolling to. Can be element or number
                text: '<i class="fa fa-chevron-circle-up" aria-hidden="true"></i>Top', // Text for element, can contain HTML

                skin: null,
                throttle: 250,

                namespace: 'scrollToTop'
            });
        });
        function validateForm(){
            var name=document.contactUsForm.name.value;
            var message=document.contactUsForm.message.value;
            var email=document.contactUsForm.email.value;

            if (name==null || name==""){
                alert("Name can't be blank");
                return false;
            }else if(email==null || email==""){
                alert("Email can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
            else if(message==null || message==""){
                alert("Message can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
        }

    <section class="bg-act-section padding-bottom-20">
        <div class="row">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12">
                <div class="text-center">
                    <h3>

                        The Explosives Act, 1884 

                        
                        
                    </h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            <h4 style="color: #fff;"> (
                                
                                    
                                    
                                        
                                            
                                            ACT
                                        
                                        NO. IV OF 1884
                                    
                                

                                )
                            </h4>
                        
                    
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section class="bt-act-section-search ">
        <div class="row">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-bottom12 col-md-12 col-lg-12">
                <p class="pull-left no-print">
                    <a href="#" onclick="window.history.back();return false;"><i class="fa fa-arrow-left" title="Back"
                                                                                 aria-hidden="true"></i></a></p>
                <p class="pull-right print-center publish-date">
                    [ 26th February, 1884   ]
                </p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    
    <section
            class="padding-bottom-20 ">
        <div class="row margin-top-20 ">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12 lineremove">
                <button class="printIco print-only pull-right" onclick="window.print();return false;"
                        style="width: 72px;height: 80px;"><i
                        class="fa fa-print" style="font-size: 40px;"></i></button>
                
                    
                    
                        <div class="row">
                            <div class="text-center act-role-style">
                                
                                <strong>
                                    	<span class='footnote' href='#' title='Throughout this Act, except otherwise provided, the words â€œBangladeshâ€, â€œGovernmentâ€ and â€œTakaâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œPakistanâ€, â€œappropriate Governmentâ€ or â€œappropriate Government or any Provincial Governmentâ€ or â€œCentral Governmentâ€ and â€œrupeesâ€ respectively by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >1</a></sup></span></span>â™£An Act to regulate the manufacture, possession, use, sale, transport and importation of Explosives.

                                    
                                    
                                </strong>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="row">
                            
                            <div class="col-md-12 pad-right">
                                <p>

                                    
                                    <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>WHEREAS it is expedient to regulate the manufacture, possession, use, sale, transport and importation of explosives; It is hereby enacted as follows:-<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div> <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

                                    
                                    
                                </p>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    
                    
                
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section class="padding-bottom-20 bg-striped ">
        
        
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Short title

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    1. (1) This Act may be called the <a title='Explosives Act, 1884' href='/act-52.html'>Explosives Act, 1884</a>; and

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            Local extent

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    (2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Commencement

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    2. (1) This Act shall come into force on such day as the Government, by notification in the official Gazette, appoints.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) [Repealed by the Amending Act, 1891 (Act XII of 1891).] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Repealed]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    3. [Repealed by section 2 and Schedule II of the Indian Ports Act, 1889 (Act X of 1889).] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Definitions

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    4. In this Act, unless there is something repugnant in the subject or context,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>			(1)  â€œexplosiveâ€	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	means gunpowder, nitro-glycerine, dynamite, gun-cotton, blasting powders, fulminate of mercury or of other metals, coloured fires and every other substance, whether similar to those above-mentioned or not, used or manufactured with a view to produce a practical effect by explosion, or a pyrotechnic effect; and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	includes fog-signals, fireworks, fuses, rockets, percussion-caps, detonators, cartridges, ammuni-tion of all descriptions, and every adaptation or preparation of an explosive as above defined:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2)  â€œManufactureâ€ includes the process of dividing into its component parts, or otherwise breaking up or unmaking, any explosive, or making fit for use any damaged explosive, and the process of re-making, altering or repairing any explosive:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) 	â€œvesselâ€ includes every ship, boat and other vessel used in navigation, whether propelled by oars or otherwise:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) 	â€œcarriageâ€ includes any carriage, wagon, cart, truck, vehicle or other means of conveying goods, or passengers by land, in whatever manner the same may be propelled:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(5) â€œmasterâ€ includes every person (except a pilot or harbourmaster) having for the time being command or charge of a vessel: provided that, in reference to any boat belonging to a ship, â€œmasterâ€ shall mean the master of the ship:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(6) 	â€œimportâ€ means to bring into Bangladesh by  <span class='footnote'  title='The words and comma â€œair, seaâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œseaâ€ by section 2 of the Explosives (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XX of 1987)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >2</a></sup></span></span>[air, sea] or land.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> <span class='footnote'  title='Clause 7 was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >3</a></sup></span></span>[* * *]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Power to make rules as to licensing of the manufacture, possession, use, sale, transport and importation of explosives

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    5. (1) The Government may for any part of Bangladesh, make rules consistent with this Act to regulate or prohibit, except under and in accordance with the conditions of a license granted as provided by those rules, the manufacture, possession, use, sale, transport and importation of explosives, or any specified class of explosives.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Rules under this section may provide for all or any of the following, among other matters, that is to say:-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	the authority by which licenses may be granted;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	the fees to be charged for licenses, and the other sums (if any) to be paid for expenses by applicants for licenses;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	the manner in which applications for licenses must be made, and the matters to be specified in such applications;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	the form in which, and the conditions on and subject to which, licenses must be granted;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(e)	the period for which licenses are to remain in force; and 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(f)	the exemption absolutely or subject to conditions of any explosives from the operation of the rules.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) Rules made under this section may impose penalties on all persons manufacturing, possessing, using, selling, transporting or importing explosives in breach of the rules, or otherwise contravening the rules:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> <span class='footnote'  title='The proviso was substituted, for the former proviso by section 3 of the Explosives (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XX of 1987)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >4</a></sup></span></span>[Provided that the penalty which may be imposed by any such rules shall be,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	in the case of a person so manufacturing, using or importing an explosive, an imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years and shall not be less than two years, and also a fine which may extend to fifty thousand Taka in default of which a further imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year, 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	in the case of a person so selling or transporting an explosive, an imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years and shall not be less than one year and also a fine which may extend to thirty thousand Taka in default of which a further imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	in the case of a person so possessing an explosive, an imprisonment for a term which may extend to five years and shall not be less than six months, and also a fine which may extend to twenty thousand Taka in default of which a further imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	in any other case, an imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years and shall not be less than three months, and also a fine which may extend to ten thousand Taka in default of which a further imprisonment for a term which may extend to three month.]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Power for Government to prohibit the manufacture, possession or importation of specially dangerous explosives

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    6. (1) Notwithstanding anything in the rules under the last foregoing section, the Government may, from time to time by notification in the official Gazette,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a) 	prohibit, either absolutely or subject to conditions, the manufacture, possession  <span class='footnote'  title='The words and commas â€œuse, sale, transportationâ€ were inserted by section 4 of the Explosives (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XX of 1987).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >5</a></sup></span></span>[use, sales, transportation] or importation of any explosive which is of so dangerous a character that, in the opinion of the Government it is expedient for the public safety to issue the notification; 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	[Repealed by the Repealing and Amending Act 1914 (Act No. X of 1914).]	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The officers of  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œseaâ€ was omitted by section 4 of the Explosives (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XX of 1987).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >6</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] customs at every  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œport or border check-postâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œportâ€ by section 4 of the Explosives (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XX of 1987).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >7</a></sup></span></span>[port or border check-post] shall have the same power in respect of any explosive with regard to the importation of which a notification has been issued under this section and the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œvessel or carriageâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œvesselâ€ by section 4 of the Explosives (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XX of 1987).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='5' >8</a></sup></span></span>[vessel or carriage] containing the explosive as they have for the time-being in respect of any article the importation of which is prohibited or 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>regulated by the law relating to  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œseaâ€ was omitted by section 4 of the Explosives (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XX of 1987).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='6' >9</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] customs and the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œvessel or carriageâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œvesselâ€ by section 4 of the Explosives (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XX of 1987).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='7' >10</a></sup></span></span>[vessel or carriage] containing the same; and the enactments for the time being in force relating to  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œseaâ€ was omitted by section 4 of the Explosives (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XX of 1987).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='8' >11</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] customs or any such article or  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œvessel or carriageâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œvesselâ€ by section 4 of the Explosives (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XX of 1987).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='9' >12</a></sup></span></span>[vessel or carriage] shall apply accordingly.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> <span class='footnote'  title='Sub-section (3) was substituted, for the former sub-section (3) by the Explosives (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XX of 1987), section 4.'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='10' >13</a></sup></span></span>[(3) Any person manufacturing, possessing, using, selling, transporting or importing an explosive in contravention of a notification issued under this section shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years and shall not be less than two years and also with a fine which may extend to fifty thousand Taka, in default of which with a further imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year, and in the case of importation by water or land, the owner and master of the vessel or carriage in which the explosive is imported shall, in the absence of reasonable excuse, each be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years and shall not be less than two years and also with a fine which may extend to fifty thousand Taka, in default of which with a further imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year.]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Power to make rules conferring powers of inspection, search, seizure, detention and removal

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    7.(1) The Government may make rules consistent with this Act authorizing any officer, either by name or in virtue of his office-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	to enter, inspect and examine any place, carriage or vessel in which an explosive is being manufactured, possessed, used, sold, transported or imported under a license granted under this Act, or in which he has reason to believe that an explosive has been or is being manufactured, possessed, used, sold, trans-ported or imported in contravention of this Act or of the rules made under this Act;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	to search for explosives therein;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	to take samples of any explosive found therein on payment of the value thereof; and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	to seize, detain, remove and, if necessary, destroy any explosive found therein.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The provisions of the Code of Criminal Procedure relating to searches under that Code shall, so far as the same are applicable, apply to searches by officers authorised by rules under this section.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Notice of accidents

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    8. (1) Whenever there occurs in or about, or in connection with, any place in which an explosive is manufactured, possessed or used, or any carriage or vessel either conveying an explosive or on or from which an explosive is being loaded or unloaded, any accident by explosion or by fire attended with loss of human life or serious injury to person or property, or of a description usually attended with such loss or injury, the occupier of the place, or the master of the vessel, or the person in charge of the carriage, as the case may be, shall within such time and in such manner as may be by rule prescribed give notice thereof and of the attendant loss of human life or personal injury, if any, to the Chief Inspector of Explosives in Bangladesh and to the officer in charge of the nearest police-station.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> <span class='footnote'  title='Sub-section (2) was substituted, for the former sub-section (2) by section 5 of the Explosives (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XX of 1987)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >14</a></sup></span></span>[(2) Whoever in contravention of sub-section (1) fails to give notice of any accident shall be punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months and also with a fine which may extend to five thousand Taka, in default of which with a further imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, and, if the accident is attended by loss of human life, with imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year and also with a fine which may extend to ten thousand Taka, in default of which with a further imprisonment which may extend to two months.] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Inquiry into accidents

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <span class='footnote'  title='Sections 9 and 9A were substituted, for section 9 by the Explosives (Amendment) Ordinance, 1945 (Ordinance No. XVIII of 1945)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >15</a></sup></span></span>[9.(1) Where any accident such as is referred to in section 8 occurs in or about or in connection with any place, carriage or vessel under the control of any of the armed forces of Bangladesh,  an  inquiry  into  the  causes of the accident shall be held by the naval, military, or air force authority concerned, and where any such accident occurs in any other circumstances, the district Magistrate  <span class='footnote'  title='The words and commas â€œor, in the Dacca Metropolitan Area, the Police Commissionerâ€ were inserted by section 12 and Schedule of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. LXIX of 1976).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >16</a></sup></span></span>[or, in  <span class='footnote'  title='The letter and words â€œa Metropolitan Areaâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œthe Dacca Metropolitan Areaâ€ by second Schedule of the Chittagong Metropolitan Police (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLVIII of 1978).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >17</a></sup></span></span>[a Metropolitan Area], the Police Commissioner] shall, in cases attended by loss of human life, or may, in any other case, hold or direct a Magistrate  <span class='footnote'  title='The words, letter and commas â€œor a police officer, as the case may be,â€ were inserted by section 12 and Schedule of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. LXIX of 1978).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >18</a></sup></span></span>[or a police officer, as the case may be,] sub-ordinate to him to hold, such an inquiry.		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Any person holding an inquiry under this section shall have all the powers of a Magistrate in holding an inquiry into an offence under the <a title='Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898' href='/act-75.html'>Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898</a> and may exercise such of the powers conferred on any officer by rules under section 7 as he may think it necessary or expedient to exercise for the purposes of the inquiry.		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) The person holding an inquiry under this section shall make a report to the Government stating the causes of the accident and its circumstances.		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) The Government may make rules-		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	to regulate the procedure at inquires under this section;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	to enable the Chief Inspector of Explosives in Bangladesh to be present or represented at any such inquiry;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	to permit the Chief Inspector of Explosives in Bangladesh or his representative to examine any witnesses at the inquiry;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	to provide that where the Chief Inspector of Explosives in Bangladesh is not present or represented at any such inquiry, a report of the proceedings thereof shall be sent to him;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(e)	to prescribe the manner in which and the time within which notices referred to in section 8 shall be given.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Inquiry into more serious accidents

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    9A. (1) The Government may, where it is of opinion, whether or not it has received the report of an inquiry under section 9, that an inquiry of more formal character should be held into the causes of an accident such as is referred to in section 8, appoint the Chief Inspector of Explosives in Bangladesh or any other competent person to hold such inquiry, and may also appoint one or more persons possessing legal or special knowledge to act as assessors in such inquiry.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Where the Government orders an inquiry under this section, it may also direct that any inquiry under section 9 pending at the time shall be discontinued.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) The person appointed to hold an inquiry under this section shall have all the powers of a Civil Court under the <a title='Code of Civil Procedure, 1908' href='/act-86.html'>Code of Civil Procedure, 1908</a>, for the purposes of enforcing the attendance of witnesses and compelling the production of documents and material objects; and every person required by such person as aforesaid to furnish any information shall be deemed to be legally bound so to do within the meaning of section 176 of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œPenal Codeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œPakistan Penal Codeâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >19</a></sup></span></span>[Penal Code].<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) Any person holding an inquiry under this section may exercise such of the powers conferred on any officer by rules under section 7 as he may think it necessary or expedient to exercise for the purposes of the inquiry.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(5) The person holding an inquiry under this section shall make a report to the Government stating the causes of the accident and its circumstances, and adding any observations which he or any of the assessors may think fit to make; and the Government shall cause every report so made to be published at such time and in such manner as it may think fit.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(6) The Government may make rules for regulating the procedure at inquires under this section.] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Forfeiture of explosives

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    10. When a person is convicted of an offence punishable under this Act or the rules made under this Act, the Court before which he is convicted may direct that the explosive, or ingredient of the explosive, or the substance (if any) in respect of which the offence has been committed, or any part of that explosive, ingredient or substance, shall, with the receptacles containing the same, be forfeited. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Distress of vessel

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    11. Where the owner or master of a Vessel is adjudged under this Act to pay a fine for an offence committed with, or in relation to, that vessel, the Court may, in addition to any other power it may have for the purpose of compelling payment of the fine, direct it to be levied by distress and sale of the vessel, and the tackle, apparel and furniture thereof, or so much thereof as is necessary. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Abetment and attempts

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    12. Whoever abets, within the meaning of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œPenal Codeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œPakistan Penal Codeâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >20</a></sup></span></span>[Penal Code], the commission of an offence punishable under this Act, or the rules made under this Act, or attempts to commit any such offence and in such attempt does any act towards the commission of the same, shall be punished as if he had committed the offence. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Power to arrest without warrant persons committing dangerous offences

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    13. Whoever is found committing any act for which he is punishable under this Act or the rules under this Act, and which tends to cause explosion or fire in or about any place where an explosive is manufactured or stored, or any railway or port, or any carriage, ship or boat, may be apprehended without warrant by a Police-officer, or by the occupier of, or the agent or servant of, or other person authorised by the occupier of, that place, or by any agent or servant of, or other person authorised by, the railway administration or conservator of the port, and be removed from the place where he is arrested and conveyed as soon as conveniently may be before a Magistrate. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Saving and power to exempt

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    14. (1) Nothing in this Act, except sections 8, 9 and 9A, shall apply to the manufacture, possession, use, transport or importation of any explosive-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	by any of the armed forces of Bangladesh in accordance with rules or regulations made by the Government;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	by any person employed under the Government in execution of this Act.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> (2) The Government may by notification in the official Gazette exempt, absolutely or subject to any such conditions as it may think fit to impose, any explosive from all or any of the provisions of this Act.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>15. Nothing in this Act shall affect the provisions of the <a title='Arms Act, 1878' href='/act-38.html'>Arms Act, 1878</a>:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that an authority granting a license under this Act for the manufacture, possession, sale, transport or importation of an explosive may, if empowered in this behalf by the rules under which the license is granted, direct by an order written on the license that it shall have the effect of a like license granted under the said Arms Act.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>16. Nothing in this Act or the rules under this Act shall prevent any person from being prosecuted under any other law for any act or omission which constitutes an offence against this Act or those rules, or from being liable under that other law to any other or higher punishment or penalty than that provided by this Act or those rules: Provided that a person shall not be punished twice for the same offence.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>17. The Government may, from time to time, by notification in the official Gazette, declare that any substance which appears to the Government to be specially dangerous to life or property, by reason either of its explosive properties or of any process in the manufacture thereof being liable to explosion, shall be deemed to be an explosive within the meaning of this Act, and the provisions of this Act (subject to such exceptions, limitations, and restrictions as may be specified in the notification) shall accordingly extend to that substance in like manner as if it were included in the definition or the term â€œexplosiveâ€ in this Act.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>18. (1) An authority making rules under this Act shall, before making the rules, publish a draft of the proposed rules for the information of persons likely to be affected thereby.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The publication shall be made in such manner as the Government, from time to time, by notification in the official Gazette prescribes.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) There shall be published with the draft a notice specifying a date at or after which the draft will be taken into consideration.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) The authority making the rules shall receive and consider any objection or suggestion which may be made by any person with respect to the draft before the date so specified.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(5) A rule made under this Act shall not take effect until it has been published in the official Gazette.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(6) The publication in the official Gazette or a rule purporting to be made under this Act shall be conclusive evidence that it has been duly made, and, if it requires sanction, that it has been duly sanctioned.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(7) All powers to make rules conferred by this Act may be exercised from time to time as occasion requires.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Saving of Arms Act, 1878

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    15. Nothing in this Act shall affect the provisions of the <a title='Arms Act, 1878' href='/act-38.html'>Arms Act, 1878</a>:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that an authority granting a license under this Act for the manufacture, possession, sale, transport or importation of an explosive may, if empowered in this behalf by the rules under which the license is granted, direct by an order written on the license that it shall have the effect of a like license granted under the said Arms Act. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Saving as to liability under other law

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    16. Nothing in this Act or the rules under this Act shall prevent any person from being prosecuted under any other law for any act or omission which constitutes an offence against this Act or those rules, or from being liable under that other law to any other or higher punishment or penalty than that provided by this Act or those rules: Provided that a person shall not be punished twice for the same offence. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Extension of definition of â€œexplosiveâ€ to other explosive substances

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    17. The Government may, from time to time, by notification in the official Gazette, declare that any substance which appears to the Government to be specially dangerous to life or property, by reason either of its explosive properties or of any process in the manufacture thereof being liable to explosion, shall be deemed to be an explosive within the meaning of this Act, and the provisions of this Act (subject to such exceptions, limitations, and restrictions as may be specified in the notification) shall accordingly extend to that substance in like manner as if it were included in the definition or the term â€œexplosiveâ€ in this Act. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Procedure for making publication and confirmation of rules

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    18. (1) An authority making rules under this Act shall, before making the rules, publish a draft of the proposed rules for the information of persons likely to be affected thereby.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The publication shall be made in such manner as the Government, from time to time, by notification in the official Gazette prescribes.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) There shall be published with the draft a notice specifying a date at or after which the draft will be taken into consideration.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) The authority making the rules shall receive and consider any objection or suggestion which may be made by any person with respect to the draft before the date so specified.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(5) A rule made under this Act shall not take effect until it has been published in the official Gazette.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(6) The publication in the official Gazette or a rule purporting to be made under this Act shall be conclusive evidence that it has been duly made, and, if it requires sanction, that it has been duly sanctioned.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(7) All powers to make rules conferred by this Act may be exercised from time to time as occasion requires. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

Metropolitan Police (Amendment) Ordinance, 1978 (Ordinance No. XLVIII of 1978).</li><li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>18</sup> </h6>The words, letter and commas â€œor a police officer, as the case may be,â€ were inserted by section 12 and Schedule of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police (Amendment) Ordinance, 1976 (Ordinance No. LXIX of 1978).</li> <li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>19</sup> </h6>The words â€œPenal Codeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œPakistan Penal Codeâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973)</li> <li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>20</sup> </h6>The words â€œPenal Codeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œPakistan Penal Codeâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973)</li>

            </ul>
