                text: '<i class="fa fa-chevron-circle-up" aria-hidden="true"></i>Top', // Text for element, can contain HTML

                skin: null,
                throttle: 250,

                namespace: 'scrollToTop'
            });
        });
        function validateForm(){
            var name=document.contactUsForm.name.value;
            var message=document.contactUsForm.message.value;
            var email=document.contactUsForm.email.value;

            if (name==null || name==""){
                alert("Name can't be blank");
                return false;
            }else if(email==null || email==""){
                alert("Email can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
            else if(message==null || message==""){
                alert("Message can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
        }

<div class="col-md-11 boxed-layout " style="padding: 10px;width: 97%">
    <section class="bg-act-section padding-bottom-20">
        <div class="row">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12">
                <div class="text-center">
                    <h3>

                        The Ferries Act, 1885 

                        
                        
                    </h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            <h4 style="color: #fff;"> (
                                
                                    
                                    
                                        
                                            
                                            ACT
                                        
                                        NO. I OF 1885
                                    
                                

                                )
                            </h4>
                        
                    
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section class="bt-act-section-search ">
        <div class="row">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-bottom12 col-md-12 col-lg-12">
                <p class="pull-left no-print">
                    <a href="#" onclick="window.history.back();return false;"><i class="fa fa-arrow-left" title="Back"
                                                                                 aria-hidden="true"></i></a></p>
                <p class="pull-right print-center publish-date">
                    [ 27th May, 1885   ]
                </p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    
    <section
            class="padding-bottom-20 ">
        <div class="row margin-top-20 ">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12 lineremove">
                <button class="printIco print-only pull-right" onclick="window.print();return false;"
                        style="width: 72px;height: 80px;"><i
                        class="fa fa-print" style="font-size: 40px;"></i></button>
                
                    

                        <div class="row">
                            <div class="col-md-2"></div>
                            <div class="col-md-10 text-center act-role-style">
                                
                                <strong>
                                    <span class='footnote' href='#' title='Throughout this Act, except otherwise provided, the words â€œBangladeshâ€, â€œGovernmentâ€ and â€œTakaâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œEast Pakistanâ€, â€œProvincial Governmentâ€ and â€œRupeesâ€ respectively by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >1</a></sup></span></span>â™£An Act to regulate Ferries in Bangladesh.

                                    
                                    
                                </strong>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="row">
                            
                            
                            
                                <div class="col-md-2">&nbsp;&nbsp;Preamble</div>
                            

                            <div class="col-md-10">

                                
                                <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>WHEREAS it is expedient to regulate ferries in Bangla-desh; It is enacted as follows:-   <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>    <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

                                
                                
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    
                    
                    
                
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section class="padding-bottom-20 bg-striped ">
        
        
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                PRELIMINARY

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Short title

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    1. This Act may be called the  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œBengalâ€ was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >2</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] <a title='Ferries Act, 1885' href='/act-54.html'>Ferries Act, 1885</a>. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Extent and commencement

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    2. It extends to the whole of Bangladesh and shall come into force on such date as the Government may by notification in the official Gazette appoint in this behalf. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Omitted]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    	3. [Omitted by First Schedule of the East Pakistan Ordinance, 1962 (Ordinance No. XIII of 1962).] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            4. 	Act not to apply to municipal ferries

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    4. Nothing in this Act contained shall apply to any ferry deemed or declared to be a municipal ferry under the provisions of the Municipal Administration Ordinance, 1960. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Interpretation

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    5. In this Act, unless there be something repugnant in the subject or context,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>â€œCommissionerâ€ means the Commissioner of a Division:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>â€œferryâ€ includes a bridge of boats, pontoons or rafts, a swing-bridge, a flying bridge, a temporary bridge, and a landing stage:â€œnotificationâ€ means a notification published in the official Gazette.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>â€œprivate ferriesâ€ includes all ferries other than those declared to be public ferries, or established as such, under section 6 of this Act.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                
                    <div class="act-part-group head">
                        
                            <p class="act-part-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                

                                <a href="/act-54/part-44.html">
                                    à¦­à¦¾à¦— à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® I

                                </a>

                                
                                

                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-part-name">
                                

                                <a href="/act-54/part-44.html">


                                    PUBLIC FERRIES

                                </a>
                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Power to declare, establish, define and discontinue public 	ferries

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    6. It shall be lawful for the Government from time to time to- 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	declare what ferries shall be deemed public ferries, and the respective districts in which, for the purposes of this Act, they shall be deemed to be situate;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	take possession of a private ferry and declare it to be a public ferry;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	establish new public ferries where, in its opinion, they are needed;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	define the limits of any public ferry; 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(e)	change the course of any public ferry; and 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(f)	discontinue any public ferry which it deems unnecessary.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Every such declaration, establishment, definition, change or discontinuance shall be made by notification:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that, when any alteration in the course or in the limits of a public ferry is rendered necessary by changes in the river on which such ferry is established, such alteration may be made, by an order in writing, by the Magistrate of the district.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Control of public ferries vested in the Magistrate of the 	district

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    7. The control of all public ferries shall be vested in the Magistrate of the district, subject to the direction of the Commissioner. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Superintendence of public ferries

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    8. The immediate superintendence of every public ferry shall be vested in the Magistrate of the district in which such ferry is situated, or in such other officer as the Government may, from time to time, either by name or by official designation, appoint. <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> And such Magistrate or officer shall, except when the tolls at such ferry are leased, make all necessary arrangements for the supply of boats for such ferry, and for the collection of the authorised tolls liveable thereat. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Ferry tolls may be leased by auction

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    9. The tolls of any public ferry may, from time to time, be leased by public auction for such term as the Magistrate of the district in which such ferry is situated may, with the approval of the Commissioner, direct.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>The Magistrate of the district or the officer authorised by him to conduct such auction may, for sufficient reason to be recorded in writing, refuse to accept the offer of the highest bidder, and may accept any other bid, or may withdraw the tolls from auction.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            Execution of contract by lessee

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    The lessee of the tolls of every ferry which have been leased under this section shall execute a contract setting forth the conditions on which the tolls of such ferry are to be held, and shall give security for its due fulfilment. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Lessee of the tolls of a public ferry and his servants bound 	to conform to rules

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    10. When the tolls of a public ferry have been duly leased, the lessee and every servant of the lessee shall be deemed to be legally bound to conform to the rules made under this Act for the management and control of such ferry. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Provision for the establishment of subsidiary ferry

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    11. On the requisition of the Magistrate of the district the person in change of a public ferry situate in such district shall maintain at one or more places, in addition to the place at which the said public ferry is established, and within two miles therefrom, such number of subsidiary ferries as may seem to the Magistrate to be necessary for the public convenience: and all the provisions contained in this Act in regard to the management and control of public ferries shall be deemed applicable to any subsidiary ferry maintained under the requisition of the Magistrate. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Recovery of arrears from lessee

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    12. All arrears due by the lessee of the tools of a public ferry on account of his lease;<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>any pecuniary forfeiture for breach of contract inserted in the deed of contract or conditions of sale by public auction; and<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>all sums due from the lessee on the surrender of his lease under section 14,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>may be recovered from the lessee or his surety (if any) as a demand under the  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œBengalâ€ was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >3</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] Public Demands Recovery Act, 1913, or any other Act at the time being in force for the recovery of public demands. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Power to cancel lease

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    13. The lease of the tolls of any public ferry shall be liable to be cancelled at once by the Magistrate of the district in which such ferry is situated, if it shall appear to such Magistrate that the lessee has failed to make due provision for the convenience or safety of the public within fifteen days after being required to do so by a notice in writing from such Magistrate. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Surrender of lease

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    14. The lessee of the tolls of a public ferry may surrender his lease on the expiration of one month's notice in writing to the Magistrate of the district in which such ferry is situated of his intention to surrender such lease, and on payment of such reasonable compensation as the Magistrate may, with the approval of the Commissioner, in each case direct. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Power to make rules in regard to public ferries

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    15. The Magistrate of the district, with the approval of the Commissioner, may from time to time make rules consistent with this Act,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	for the management of all public ferries within such district, and for regulating the traffic at such ferries;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	for regulating the time and manner at and in which the terms in which, and the person by whom, the tolls of such ferries may be leased by auction;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	for compensating persons who have compounded for tolls payable for the use of any such ferry when such ferry has been discontinued before the expiration of the period compounded for; and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	generally, to carry out the purposes of this Act:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>And, when the tolls of a ferry have been leased under section 9, such Magistrate may, from time to time, with such approval as aforesaid, make additional rules consistent with this Act,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(e)	for collecting the rents payable for the tolls of such ferries;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(f)	for regulating the returns of traffic to be, from time to time, submitted by the lessee of such ferries;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(g)	in cases in which the communication is to be established by means of a bridge of boats, pontoons or rafts, or a swing-bridge, flying-bridge or temporary bridge, for regulating the time and manner at and in which such bridge shall be constructed and maintained, and opened for the passage of vessels and rafts through the same, and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(h)	in cases in which the traffic is conveyed in boats, for regulating-<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>the number and kinds of such boats and their dimensions and equipment;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>the number of the crew to be kept by the lessee for each boat;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>the maintenance of such boats in good condition;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>the hours during which, and the intervals within which, the lessee shall be bound to ply; and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>the number of passengers, animals and vehicles, and the bulk and weight or other things that may be carried in each kind of boat at one trip;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>and may, from time to time, with such approval as aforesaid, repeal or alter such rules.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Rules made under this section shall be subject to the control of the Government, and shall be published in the official Gazette in such manner as the Government directs, and shall thereupon have the force or law.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Private ferry not to ply within two miles of public ferry 	without sanction

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    16. No person shall, except with the sanction of the Magistrate of the district, maintain a ferry to or from any point within a distance of two miles from the limits of a public ferry:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that, in the case of any specified public ferry, the Government may, by notification, reduce or increase the said distance of two miles to such extent as it thinks fit:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided also that nothing hereinbefore contained shall prevent persons keeping boats to ply between two places, one of which is without, and one within, the said limits, when the distance between such two places is not less than three miles, or shall apply to boats which the Magistrate of the district expressly exempts from the operation of this section. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Claims for compensation and what amount to be awarded

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    17. Claims for compensation for any loss sustained by any person in consequent of a private ferry being taken possession of, or a new public ferry, or subsidiary ferry, being established under section 6 or section 11, shall be inquired into by the Magistrate of the district in which such ferry is situated, who shall, with the approval of the Commissioner, award compensation to any person who may appear justly entitled thereto.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Such compensation shall be calculated upon an estimate of the annual net profit actually realized by such person from such ferry on an average of the five years next preceding such declaration, and shall in no case exceed the amount of fifteen times such net annual profit. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Tolls

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    18. Tolls, according to such rates as may, from time to time, be fixed by the Magistrate of the district with the approval of the Commissioner, shall be levied on all person, animals, vehicles and other things crossing any river by a public ferry and not employed or transmitted on the public service:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that the Government may, from time to time, declare that any persons, animals, vehicles or other things shall be exempt from payment of such tolls.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Where the tolls of a ferry have been leased under section 9, any such declaration, if made after the date of the auction, shall entitle the lessee to such abatement of the rent payable in respect of the tolls as may be fixed by the Magistrate of the district under this section. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Table of tolls

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    19. The lessee or other person authorised to collect the tolls of any public ferry shall affix a table of such tolls, legibly written or printed in the  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œBengaliâ€ was substituted, for the word â€œvernacularâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >4</a></sup></span></span>[Bengali] language, and also, if the Commissioner so directs, in English, in some conspicuous place near the ferry:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>and shall be bound to produce, on demand, a list of the tolls signed by the Magistrate of the district or such other officer as he appoints in this behalf. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Omitted]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    20. [Omitted by Schedule IV of the Government of India (Adaptation of Indian Laws) Order, 1937.]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Compounding for tolls

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    21. It shall be lawful for the Magistrate of the district in which a public ferry is situated, with the approval of the Commissioner, from time to time to fix rates at which any person may compound for the tolls payable for the use of such ferry.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                
                    <div class="act-part-group head">
                        
                            <p class="act-part-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                

                                <a href="/act-54/part-45.html">
                                    à¦­à¦¾à¦— à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® II

                                </a>

                                
                                

                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-part-name">
                                

                                <a href="/act-54/part-45.html">


                                    PRIVATE FERRIES

                                </a>
                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Power to make rules in regard to private ferries

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    22. The Commissioner may from time to time make rules consistent with this Act, for the maintenance of order, and for the safety of passengers and property, at private ferries situated in his division.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Rules made under this section shall be subject to the control of the Government, and shall be published in the official Gazette in such manner as the Government directs, and shall thereupon have the force of law. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                
                    <div class="act-part-group head">
                        
                            <p class="act-part-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                

                                <a href="/act-54/part-46.html">
                                    à¦­à¦¾à¦— à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® III

                                </a>

                                
                                

                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-part-name">
                                

                                <a href="/act-54/part-46.html">


                                    PENALTIES AND CRIMINAL PROCEDURE

                                </a>
                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Penalty for breach of provisions as to table of tolls, list of 	tolls and return of traffic

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    23. Every lessee or other person authorised to collect the tolls or a public ferry, who neglects to affix and keep in good order and repair the table of tolls mentioned in section 19,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>or who wilfully removes, alters or defaces such table, or allows it to become illegible,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>or who fails to produce on demand the list of the tolls mentioned in section 19,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>and every lessee who neglects to furnish any return required under section 15,<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>shall be punished with fine which may extend to fifty Taka. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            		Penalty for taking unauthorised tolls, and for causing 	delay

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    24. Every such lessee or other person as aforesaid asking or taking more than the lawful toll, or without due cause delaying any person, animals, vehicle or other thing, shall be punished with fine which may extend to one hundred Taka. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Penalty for breach of rules made under sections 15 and 	22

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    25. Every person breaking any rule made under section 15 or section 22 shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to two hundred Taka, or with both. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Cancellation of lease on default or breach of rules

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    26. When any lessee of the tolls of a public ferry makes default in the payment of the rent payable in respect of such tolls, or has been convicted of an offence under section 25, or, having been convicted of an offence under section 23 or section 24, is again convicted of an offence under either of those sections, the Magistrate of the district may, with the approval of the Commissioner, cancel the lease of the tolls of such ferry, and make other arrangements for its management during the whole or any part of the term for which the tolls were leased. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Penalties on passengers offending

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    27. Every person crossing by any public ferry who refuses to pay the proper toll, and every person-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>who, with intent to avoid payment of such toll, fraudulently or forcibly crosses by any such ferry without paying the toll, or	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>who obstructs any toll-collector, or lessee of the tolls of any public ferry, or any of his assistants, in any way in the execution of their duty under this Act, or	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>who, after being warned by any such toll-collector, lessee or assistant not to do so, goes, or takes any animals, vehicles or other things, into any ferry boat, or upon any bridge at such a ferry, which is in such a state or so loaded as to endanger human life or property, or	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>who refuses or neglects to leave, or remove any animals, vehicles or goods from any such ferry-boat or bridge on being requested by such toll-collector, lessee or assistant to do so, or	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>who moors any boat, raft or other substance to, or in any way obstructs, any part of a public ferry.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>shall be punished with fine which may extend to fifty Taka.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            		Penalty for plying within public ferry-course without 	license

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    28. Whoever conveys for hire any passenger, animal, vehicle or other thing in contravention of the provisions of section 16 shall be punished with fine which may extend to fifty Taka. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            		Fines payable to lessee

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    29. Where the tolls of any public ferry have been leased under the provisions hereinbefore contained, the whole or any portion of the fine realized under section 27 or section 28 may be, at the discretion of the convicting Magistrate or Bench of Magistrates, paid to the lessee. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Penalty for rash navigation and stacking of timber

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    30. Whoever navigates, anchors, moors or fastens any vessel or raft, or stacks any timber, in a manner so rash or negligent as to damage a public ferry, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred Taka, or with both; and the toll-collector or lessee of the tolls of such ferry, or any of his assistants, may seize and detain such vessel, raft or timber pending the inquiry and assessment hereinafter mentioned. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Power to arrest without warrant

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    31. The police may arrest without warrant any person committing an offence against section 27 or section 30. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Magistrate may assess damage done by offender

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    32. Every Magistrate or Bench of Magistrates trying any offence under this Act may inquire into and assess the value of the damage (if any) done or caused by the offender to the ferry concerned, and shall order the amount of such value to be paid by him in addition to any fine imposed upon him under this Act; and the amount so ordered to be paid shall be leviable as if it were a fine, or when the offence is one under section 30 by the sale of the vessel, raft or timber causing the damage, and of anything found in or upon such vessel or raft.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>The Commissioner may, on the appeal of any person deeming himself aggrieved by an order under this section, reduce or remit the amount payable under such order. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                
                    <div class="act-part-group head">
                        
                            <p class="act-part-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                

                                <a href="/act-54/part-47.html">
                                    à¦­à¦¾à¦— à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® IV

                                </a>

                                
                                

                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-part-name">
                                

                                <a href="/act-54/part-47.html">


                                    MISCELLANEOUS

                                </a>
                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            		Power to take possession of boats and other appliances on 	surrender or cancellation of lease

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    33. On the cancelment or surrender of a lease, the Magistrate of the district may take possession of all boats and other appliances which have been used by the lessee in the working of the ferry; and may either retain the same permanently on payment of a fair price to the proprietor, or may retain them for such time as may be necessary, not exceeding three months, until he can make arrangements for such other boats and appliances as may be necessary, in which case the Magistrate of the district shall pay a fair sum to the owners for the use of the said boats and appliances:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that, within a week of taking such possession, the Magistrate of the district shall be bound to give notice to the said lessee of his intention to retain the said boats and appliances permanently, or for a period to be specified in the notice. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Similar power in cases of emergency

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    34. When any boats or their equipments, or any materials or appliances suitable for setting up a ferry, are emergently required for facilitating the transport of officers or troops of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œRepublicâ€ was substituted, for the word â€œStateâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >5</a></sup></span></span>[Republic] on duty, or of any other persons on the business of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œRepublicâ€ was substituted, for the word â€œStateâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >6</a></sup></span></span>[Republic] or of any animals, vehicles or baggage belonging to such officers, troops or persons, or of any property of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œRepublicâ€ was substituted, for the word â€œStateâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >7</a></sup></span></span>[Republic], the Magistrate of the district may take possession of and use the same (paying such compensation for the use thereof as the  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œGovernmentâ€ was substituted, for the words and commas â€œCentral Government, where the transport is in connection with the affairs of the Central Government, and the Provincial Government in other casesâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >8</a></sup></span></span>[Government] may  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œin each caseâ€ were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='5' >9</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] direct, until such transport is completed. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Management may be vested in local authority

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    35. It shall be lawful for the Government to order that any public ferry shall be managed by a local authority having jurisdiction over the area or any part of the area in which such ferry is situated; and such local authority shall have all the powers vested in the Magistrate of the district under this Act except the powers specified in sections 7, 17 and 32, and thereupon the ferries shall be managed accordingly. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Delegation of powers

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    36. The Government may, from time to time, delegate, under such restrictions as it thinks fit, any of the powers conferred on it by this Act to any Commissioner or Magistrate of a district, or to such other officer or authority as it thinks fit, by name or by official designation. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
                
            
            
        
        <hr/>

class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>5</sup> </h6>The word â€œRepublicâ€ was substituted, for the word â€œStateâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).</li><li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>6</sup> </h6>The word â€œRepublicâ€ was substituted, for the word â€œStateâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).</li><li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>7</sup> </h6>The word â€œRepublicâ€ was substituted, for the word â€œStateâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).</li><li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>8</sup> </h6>The word â€œGovernmentâ€ was substituted, for the words and commas â€œCentral Government, where the transport is in connection with the affairs of the Central Government, and the Provincial Government in other casesâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).</li><li class='footnoteList'><h6 class='word-formet'> <sup class='en'>9</sup> </h6>The words â€œin each caseâ€ were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).</li>

            </ul>
        </div>
    </section>
